headers.socials: You can also find me here:

paragraphs.aboutMe: Hello, my name is Adam and I'm a software developer from Poland. I love learning new stuff and using acquired knowledge in practice - either for solo or group projects.
paragraphs.aboutMe2: I consider myself to be well organised, responsible and meticulous. I am comfortable with demanding tasks that require planning and supervising their progress. I believe that code readability and clean architecture are crucial for implementing a scalable solution.
paragraphs.aboutMe3: As for my professional life, I aim to become a more capable developer every day. I want to combine technical knowledge with soft skills to solve any task with ease.

hobbies.games: I love playing and making games. My favorite games are soulslikes and Monster Hunter series :)
hobbies.gym: I spend a lot of time at the gym. I believe that physical and mental development are equally important.
hobbies.music: My favorite music genres are rock and pop.

skills.vsCode: My favorite code editor for most programming languages.
skills.intellij: My first choice when it comes to Java programming.
skills.git: I have been working with git since I started programming so I know all necessary commands. I have experience with Github and Gitlab.
skills.visualStudio: Mostly using it with Unity for gamedev, but I have implemented some C++ apps in it. I am familiar with the interface.
skills.linux: I can work in linux environment and know how to do various things from terminal like ssh, crontab, file operations, sudo etc.
skills.postgres: I have experience with using Postgres from cli and pgAdmin. I know how to integrate it with Hibernate and I am familiar with ORM concept.
skills.atlassian: I know how to use Atlassian products like Jira, Confluence or Bamboo. I was actively involved in sprint planning.
skills.liquibase: I am familiar with using liquibase along with Spring Boot as well as the concept of changelogs and changesets. I have used liquibase as a default tool for handling database migrations.
skills.cmake: I know how to setup and configure a cmake project and that's about it :)
skills.docker: My computer hates docker so I hardly ever use it. But I have some experience from work.
